metadata.synopsis: Aradin comes across the corpses of some of his friends, who were lost during the goblin raid. He's in a neutral location at a bridge and observing the corpses of his people and of goblins, who were also killed in the fight.
metadata.how_to_trigger: OE code to setup dialogue:oe denraiddonenopeaceWithout OE code:Go to Den and trigger 'plea at gates'... after this, Aradin will get into an argument with Zevlor and needs to leave. He can then be found near dead bodies beside bridge near goblin camp. Co-ordinates X:86, Y:410

131.speaker: Aradin
131.text: Thought you was busy with the foulbloods in Halsin's grove.

104.speaker: Aradin
104.text: Sucker-punching strangers - that's your bit, right?
104.context: NodeContext: Sarcasitc and bitter, since the player hit him.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: I'm looking for Halsin. Heard you might know where he is?

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Still sore about that? You had it coming.

98.speaker: Aradin
98.text: Wasn't any of your business, though, was it?

163.speaker: Aradin
163.text: Didn't think this contract could go any worse. Then you showed up.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: The goblins need to be dealt with - so I'm dealing with them.

161.speaker: Aradin
161.text: Bet you will, too. Just like my mates here did.

169.speaker: Aradin
169.text: Contract cleverly left out we'd be tits deep in these buggers.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: I have somewhere else to be.

78.speaker: Aradin
78.text: Gonna find the wizard who gave us the contract that got my people killed. Left out all the important bits, like 'Beware, treasure's beneath a pile of goblins.'

123.speaker: Player
123.text: I left as quickly as I could. I don't waste my time with devilspawn.

41.speaker: Aradin
41.text: Smart. Those bastards'll spit on your grave after running you through.

73.speaker: Aradin
73.text: Tieflings... goblins... Gods, this contract was cursed from the first.

152.speaker: Aradin
152.text: The kind that leaves half your crew dead.

0.speaker: Aradin
0.text: There's a wizard in Baldur's Gate that'll pay gobloads for a relic supposedly buried round these parts.

115.speaker: Aradin
115.text: But gold ain't any use if you're too cold to spend it.

140.speaker: Player
140.text: Let's say I want that gold. Where would I find the relic?

82.speaker: Aradin
82.text: It's called the Nightsong. Supposed to be hidden under the temple where the goblins jumped us.

14.speaker: Aradin
14.text: I'd give you a map of the temple and wish you a happy funeral, but my mate Brian kept hold of it like his own todger. Goblins made short of the fat old chunk.

120.speaker: Aradin
120.text: All I've got's the contract. Can show you where we turned back, if you feel like dying.
120.context: InternalNodeContext: Needs a mapmarker for goblins

2.speaker: Player
2.text: I hear the druids' leader went with you.

11.speaker: Aradin
11.text: As soon as he heard we had a contract to find that Nightsong relic, he was more eager than a hound in heat.

156.speaker: Aradin
156.text: When the goblins jumped us, most of my crew scarpered, just like I taught 'em to. The old codger didn't.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: And you just left him to die?

12.speaker: Aradin
12.text: Yeah, and I'd do the same again. He weren't my responsibility.

150.speaker: Aradin
150.text: If you want to play the hero, go ask the goblins nicely, and maybe they'll give you whatever's left of him.

166.speaker: Player
166.text: Hand over that contract - maybe I'll get the relic and save the druid.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Where exactly did you get jumped?

67.speaker: Aradin
67.text: The goblins are holed up in some temple ruins out west. You'll smell 'em or hear their drums before you see 'em.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: I'll take the risk. Give me the contract.

89.speaker: Aradin
89.text: Heh, don't thank me. I'll be well on my way to Baldur's Gate when you die.

17.speaker: Aradin
17.text: I'm just glad to be rid of the bloody thing. Happy hunting.
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: hands over contractInternalNodeContext: Needs a mapmarker for goblinsNodeContext: Hands over contract (piece of paper; can happen off-camera)

6.speaker: Player
6.text: This whole thing sounds like a setup.

33.speaker: Aradin
33.text: That, or a crock of shite.
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Takes a swig from the bottle after he speaks.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Before you go, I'd like to say a prayer for your crew.

64.speaker: Aradin
64.context: NodeContext: Bit skeptical. He's not a religious man but deep down he does want something said over his men.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: The Black Hand strikes and culls the unworthy. Yield in life, lest he reach for you even in death.

32.speaker: Aradin
32.text: Say another word, and I'll 'cull' you before you can blink.
32.context: NodeContext: Responding to the player saying his crew had been culled in the natural order

119.speaker: Player
119.text: Lord of Murder, I dedicate their blood to you. Praise those who spilled it!

66.speaker: Aradin
66.text: Great. I've been wasting my breath on a Bhaal lunatic.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: May they find peace now, they who died fighting so others may live. We honour them as protectors.

88.speaker: Aradin
88.text: That's true. Without these lads, we'd've been cooked.

57.speaker: Aradin
57.text: Pretty good point, for a religious type. Which one's your god again?

44.speaker: Aradin
44.text: Your man Helm seems to know what he's talking about.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: He'll make himself known to you when you are ready.

168.speaker: Player
168.text: Would that we had taken these blows in their place - but let us honour their suffering.

40.speaker: Aradin
40.text: This was a good crew. They deserved better.
40.context: NodeContext: First time he's said something halfway decent.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: Their death is but another step on the path. Kelemvor will judge them fairly.

159.speaker: Aradin
159.text: Nothing the lads would hate more than a judge waiting for 'em up there.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: These vessels are a reminder that death walks behind each of us, every day. None can outrun him. Praise Myrkul.

93.speaker: Aradin
93.text: We're leaving. Don't follow, if you know what's good for you.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: May their journey onwards be filled with as many wonders as they enjoyed in life.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Whatever doubts and mysteries plagued them in life, may they be answered in death.

121.speaker: Aradin
121.text: Folks like us ain't got unanswered questions. We got contracts to finish and mouths to feed.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: May their path into the next plane be illuminated by a thousand gentle lights.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: I commend them to the darkness. When night falls, let them be forgotten.

117.speaker: Aradin
117.text: Hard to forget idiots like these. I don't think I'll bother trying.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: May their blades be ever sharp, and their arrows ever true. We honour them, for they fought to the last.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Though I do not know how they lived, I know they died justly in combat. I honour that death.

54.speaker: Aradin
54.text: That's true, isn't it? My crew gave those nasty little shites as good as they got.

118.speaker: Aradin
118.text: Good point. For a religious type. Which one's your god again?

130.speaker: Player
130.text: I serve Tempus, god of war.

90.speaker: Aradin
90.text: Your man Tempus knows what he's talking about.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: Stay true to your blade and you will know his name soon enough.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: I pray their violent deaths find absolution in the Platinum Dragon's embrace.

92.speaker: Aradin
92.text: Should've expected judgement from a religious type. Typical.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: May the bards ever sing the song of your fallen.

61.speaker: Aradin
61.text: A song about my lot? Hah. Might toss a coin to a bard when I get back to the city.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: May their souls dance peacefully into the restful night.

148.speaker: Aradin
148.text: Don't see what good dancing'll do them.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: May the Gnomefather lead their souls over the Golden Hills.

21.speaker: Aradin
21.text: That's what I get for taking you religious types serious. Bollocks about gnomes.

129.speaker: Player
129.text: They died in the blood of their enemies, they died well. One-Eye watch them.

9.speaker: Aradin
9.text: Hm. I like that - they gave those wretched shites what for, after all.

80.speaker: Aradin
80.text: Who's that you prayed to, again? 'One-Eye'?

149.speaker: Player
149.text: The One-Eyed God. The Unsleeping. The Cursed One. GLORY TO GRUUMSH!

143.speaker: Player
143.text: Gruumsh. Creator. Watching God. First Power of the Orcs.

19.speaker: Aradin
19.text: I'll drop him a copper if I spot a shrine. Your man Gruumsh knows his stuff.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: Die with blade and blood in hand - then you will know his name.

164.speaker: Aradin
164.text: Doubt there's much chance of me dying otherwise.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Laduguer - let these wretched fallen find solace as your slave-souls.

141.speaker: Player
141.text: These fallen lights burned short, Lord. May you remember their flames evermore.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Rejoice! Their souls are ever snared in the demonwebs - to be feasted on by Mother.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Though these souls are gone, they are not lost. May they grow again in time, as all things do.

43.speaker: Aradin
43.text: Aye. Gone but not forgotten, and all that.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: An end forged in battle is not one that will be forgotten. Remember them well.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: We pray: may those that felled these noble few be sundered by the vengeful storm.

30.speaker: Aradin
30.text: Reckon it ain't long til the goblins get what's coming. Hope so, at least.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: If their souls fall to the Hells, I pray they are quickly devoured by Her of the Many Maws.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: I pray their souls find luck overflowing in the afterlife.

91.speaker: Aradin
91.text: Shame luck couldn't find them sooner.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: Vlaakith'ka sivim hrath krash'ht. Vlaakith lash'a'rach.
147.context: InternalNodeContext: meaning - "Only in vlaakith do we find light. Vlaakith make them pure."

154.speaker: Player
154.text: We pray that their spirits find nurture in the worlds beyond.

71.speaker: Aradin
71.text: 'We' ain't praying anything - that's all you.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: An adventurer's life is often short, but full of glory. May their journey onward be their next great adventure.

111.speaker: Aradin
111.text: Save your breath. They're too dead to hear you.

128.speaker: Aradin
128.text: Look, we're getting out of here. You should do the same.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: I pray their souls find rest, and their loved ones solace in this time of need.

157.speaker: Aradin
157.text: Shame solace don't put bread on the table.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: Forget it. Let's just get out of here.

107.speaker: Aradin
107.text: See you on the road, mate.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: You're giving up? I might take a shot at it myself.

116.speaker: Aradin
116.text: Have at it, if you think you can do better.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: True. I wouldn't risk it for twice the gold.

153.speaker: Aradin
153.text: Dunno what I expected. That much gold for some long-lost relic buried in the arse-end of nowhere. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

3.speaker: Aradin
3.text: And from a wizard too. I shoulda known. The gold probably turns to lead the moment you leave Baldur's Gate.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: A few goblins killed your whole crew? Pathetic.

29.speaker: Aradin
29.text: Wasn't no few goblins, mate. There's an entire hive of 'em. Contract failed to mention that part.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: I thought you were busy leading your crew.

96.speaker: Aradin
96.context: CinematicNodeContext: camera shows his dead crewNodeContext: Still blustering, but with resignation around the edges. He is sad about his dead crew, but he's trying not to show it.

165.speaker: Aradin
165.text: Contract didn't mention no goblins. I would've prepped the lads, brought better weapons...

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Honour demanded I extend my travels farther afield.

8.speaker: Aradin
8.text: That's a fancy way of saying 'I had something better to do.'

160.speaker: Aradin
160.text: Wish I'd had something better to do when I came across this contract. Bloody goblins ran through my crew - and all for nothing.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Knock it off with that 'foulblood' shit.

170.speaker: Aradin
170.text: Whatever you say. Don't matter anymore.
